about_the_game:
Room Service

Step into the dark world of Room Service, a narrative horror game with psychological elements.

You play as Jacob White, a man in desperate need of a job, who takes a position at an old motel. The tasks seem simple: cleaning and tidying up. But with each passing day, the thin veneer of normalcy begins to crack. Jacob’s struggle is further compounded by a personal tragedy: the recent death of his wife.

Experience Jacob’s Story

The events at the motel unfold from Jacob’s perspective as he reflects on the strange and increasingly unsettling occurrences he faced. The story is rich with subtle clues and shocking twists, complemented by scattered newspaper clippings, conversations, and other details Jacob uncovers during his work.

Atmospheric Horror

  • Psychological Tension: A growing sense of unease fueled by eerie sounds and a dark, oppressive atmosphere.

  • A Blend of Subtlety and Intensity: Horror elements range from creeping dread to sudden shocks, maintaining constant tension.

Your Job Becomes a Nightmare

  • Interactive Gameplay: Clean rooms, tidy spaces, and more—until nothing feels normal anymore.

  • Scripted Horror: Every event is meticulously crafted to draw you deeper into the ominous narrative.

  • No Enemies, Just Fear: There’s no traditional monster chasing you. The threat is subtle, psychological, and ever-present.

For Indie Horror Fans

Room Service is perfect for horror enthusiasts who enjoy games like Fears to Fathom and creations by Chilla’s Art. If you’re drawn to dark stories and immersive atmospheres, Room Service will captivate you.

content_descriptors.notes: Room Service contains themes of grief, loss, and death, as well as depictions of violence, blood, and intense fear. Player discretion is advised.
